item.title: Favicon Request Now In Chrome Network Panel
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Back in November I mentioned a Chrome browser ticket to include favicon requests in the network panel: Voted for @googlechrome to include favicon requests in the network panel, a pain point that I run into every day https://t.co/BvMrNTtGyF — Joseph Scott (@josephscott) November 20, 2014 I was pleasantly surprised to see it was fixed last […]
item.content:encoded:
Back in November I mentioned a Chrome browser ticket to include favicon requests in the network panel:

Voted for @googlechrome to include favicon requests in the network panel, a pain point that I run into every day https://t.co/BvMrNTtGyF

— Joseph Scott (@josephscott) November 20, 2014

I was pleasantly surprised to see it was fixed last week. Fired up my copy of Chrome Canary ( Version 42.0.2281.0, 64-bit, on Mac OS 10.10.1 ) this morning and saw this:

Should only be a matter of time before this shows up in stable releases of Chrome.

item.title: Favicon Alerts with Tinycon
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: I came across a cool favicon hack recently called Tinycon, which provides a Javascript function to add a small alert bubble to a favicon image. You can see a demo of it in action at http://tommoor.github.com/tinycon/. Basic usage is super simple: [sourcecode lang=”javascript”] Tinycon.setBubble( 6 ); [/sourcecode] sets a favicon alert bubble with the number […]
item.content:encoded:
I came across a cool favicon hack recently called Tinycon, which provides a Javascript function to add a small alert bubble to a favicon image. You can see a demo of it in action at http://tommoor.github.com/tinycon/.

Basic usage is super simple:

[sourcecode lang=”javascript”]
Tinycon.setBubble( 6 );
[/sourcecode]

sets a favicon alert bubble with the number six in it.

After looking at this I was surprised that Gmail hadn’t done this already. For that matter, perhaps the Google Chrome browser could provide some native functions to make it perform even better.

Code for Tinycon is available at https://github.com/tommoor/tinycon under the MIT open source license.
